intro: Bowlesia multiradiata, commonly known as the multi-rayed bowlesia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its unique, branched inflorescence. The plant features palmate leaves with multiple lobes and produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
